meanings.definition: To treat with excessive indulgence and care.
meanings.sent1: The puppy was cosseted by its owner, who gave it treats and belly rubs all day.
meanings.sent2: The princess was cosseted by her royal family, always surrounded by servants attending to her every need.
meanings.sent3: The cosseted cat refused to eat anything but gourmet tuna, turning its nose up at regular cat food.
meanings.sent4: The cosseted plant thrived under the careful attention of the gardener, growing taller and more vibrant each day.
meanings.sent5: The cosseted child grew up believing the world revolved around them, unprepared for the challenges of adulthood.

meanings.sent1: The cosseted cat lounged on a velvet cushion, enjoying a life of luxury and comfort.
meanings.sent2: The cosseted celebrity demanded only the finest champagne and caviar at their parties.
meanings.sent3: The cosseted puppy refused to sleep on anything but a cashmere blanket, much to the amusement of its owner.
meanings.sent4: The cosseted child grew up with a sense of entitlement, expecting everything to be handed to them on a silver platter.
meanings.sent5: The cosseted prince lived in a palace filled with opulent furnishings and servants catering to his every whim.
